channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Almost equivalences between Tamarkin category and Novikov sheaves
item.description: arXiv:2406.08245v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We revisit the relationship between the Tamarkin's extra variable $t$ and Novikov rings. We prove that the equivariant version of Tamarkin category is almost equivalent (in the sense of almost mathematics) to the category of derived complete modules over the Novikov ring.
item.dc:creator: Tatsuki Kuwagaki

item.title: Tamarkin's separation theorem for non-compact objects in cotangent bundles
item.description: arXiv:2406.08247v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this short note, we prove a Tamarkin-type separation theorem for possibly non-compact subsets in cotangent bundles.
item.dc:creator: Yuichi Ike, Tatsuki Kuwagaki

item.title: Periodic orbits of non-degenerate lacunary contact forms on prequantization bundles
item.description: arXiv:2406.08462v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A non-degenerate contact form is lacunary if the indexes of every contractible periodic Reeb orbit have the same parity. To the best of our knowledge, every contact form with finitely many periodic orbits known so far is non-degenerate and lacunary. We show that every non-degenerate lacunary contact form on a suitable prequantization of a closed symplectic manifold $B$ has precisely $r_B$ contractible closed orbits, where $r_B=\dim \mathrm{H}_*(B;{\mathbb Q})$. Examples of such prequantizations include the standard contact sphere and the unit cosphere bundle of a compact rank one symmetric space (CROSS). We also consider some prequantizations of orbifolds, like lens spaces and the unit cosphere bundle of lens spaces, and obtain multiplicity results for these prequantizations.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Abreu, Leonardo Macarini

item.title: Microlocal categories over Novikov rings
item.description: arXiv:2307.01561v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we define a family of categories for each Liouville manifold, which is an enhanced version of the category first introduced by Tamarkin. Using our categories, for any (possibly non-exact immersed) Lagrangian brane, we develop a theory of sheaf quantization generalizing the previous researches. In particular, our theory involves the notion of a sheaf-theoretic bounding cochain, which is a conjectural counterpart of the theory of Fukaya--Oh--Ohta--Ono. We also study several structures of our categories for sufficiently Weinstein manifolds and properties known in the classical Tamarkin category; intersection points estimates, interleaving distances, energy stability with respect to Guillermou--Kashiwara--Schapira autoequivalence, and the completeness of the distance. We conjecture that our category is equivalent to a Fukaya category defined over the Novikov ring.
item.dc:creator: Yuichi Ike, Tatsuki Kuwagaki

item.title: Sharp systolic inequalities for invariant tight contact forms on principal S1-bundles over S2
item.description: arXiv:2403.02228v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The systole of a contact form $\alpha$ is defined as the shortest period of closed Reeb orbits of $\alpha$. Given a non-trivial $\mathbb S^1$-principal bundle over $\mathbb S^2$ with total space $M$, we prove a sharp systolic inequality for the class of tight contact form on $M$ invariant under the $\mathbb S^1$-action. This inequality exhibits a behavior which depends on the Euler class of the bundle in a subtle way. As applications, we prove a sharp systolic inequality for rotationally symmetric Finsler metrics on $\mathbb S^2$, a systolic inequality for the shortest contractible closed Reeb orbit, and a particular case of a conjecture by Viterbo.
item.dc:creator: Simon Vialaret
